{{cpp/filesystem/path/title|make_preferred}}
{{cpp/filesystem/path/navbar}}
{{ddcl | since=c++17 |
path&amp; make_preferred();
}}

Converts all directory separators in the generic-format view of the path to the preferred directory separator.

For example, on Windows, where {{c|\}} is the preferred separator, the path {{c|foo/bar}} will be converted to {{c|foo\bar}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Example===
{{example
| Windows can use {{c|/}} as a separator, but prefers {{c|\}}, so {{c|make_preferred}} converts the forward slashes to backslashes. On the other hand, POSIX does not use {{c|\}} as a separator, because backslashes are valid filename characters â€” the Windows path on POSIX actually refers to a file with the name {{c|"a\\b\\c"}}. For this reason the "separators" are not converted.
| code=
#include &lt;filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::filesystem::path
        windows_path("a\\b\\c"),
        posix_path("a/b/c");

    std::cout
        &lt;&lt; "Windows path: "
        &lt;&lt; windows_path &lt;&lt; " -&gt; "
        &lt;&lt; windows_path.make_preferred() &lt;&lt; '\n'
        &lt;&lt; "POSIX path: "
        &lt;&lt; posix_path &lt;&lt; " -&gt; "
        &lt;&lt; posix_path.make_preferred() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
| output=
// on Windows
Windows path: "a\\b\\c" -&gt; "a\\b\\c"
POSIX path: "a/b/c" -&gt; "a\\b\\c"

// on POSIX
Windows path: "a\\b\\c" -&gt; "a\\b\\c"
POSIX path: "a/b/c" -&gt; "a/b/c"
}}
